required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Investigating the Pharmacodynamic and Pharmacokinetic Properties of Insulin Degludec/Insulin Aspart 15 in Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Trial Investigating the Pharmacodynamic and Pharmacokinetic Properties of Insulin Degludec/Insulin Aspart 15 in Subjects With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Europe. The aim of the trial is to investigate the pharmacodynamic (the effect of the investigated drug on the body) and the pharmacokinetic (exposure of the trial drug in the body) properties of insulin degludec/insulin aspart 15 in subjects with type 1 diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the glucose infusion rate curve
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 6 hours after single dose (IDegAsp 15, IDeg and IDegAsp)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum IDeg concentration-time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 120 hours after single dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the serum IAsp concentration-time curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 0 to 12 hours after single dose

intervention.description: Each subject subject will be randomly allocated to five single doses. Administered subcutaneously (s.c, under the skin) on five dosing visits separated by 15-25 days. The dose level will be 0.5 U/kg Body Weight (BW).

Each subject subject will be randomly allocated to five single doses. Administered subcutaneously (s.c, under the skin) on five dosing visits separated by 15-25 days. The dose level will be 0.5 U/kg Body Weight (BW).

Each subject subject will be randomly allocated to five single doses. Administered subcutaneously (s.c, under the skin) on five dosing visits separated by 15-25 days. The dose level will be 0.425 U/kg Body Weight (BW).

Each subject subject will be randomly allocated to five single doses. Administered subcutaneously (s.c, under the skin) on five dosing visits separated by 15-25 days. The dose level will be 0.075 U/kg Body Weight (BW).
Each subject subject will be randomly allocated to five single doses. Administered subcutaneously (s.c, under the skin) on five dosing visits separated by 15-25 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes mellitus (as diagnosed clinically) for at least 12 months
- Body mass index 18.0-28.0 kg/m^2 (both inclusive)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject who has donated any blood or plasma in the past month or more than 500 mL within 3 months prior to screening
- Smoker (defined as a subject who is smoking more than 5 cigarettes or the equivalent per day)
- Not able or willing to refrain from smoking, use of nicotine substitute products or transdermal nicotine patches during the inpatient period
- Female of childbearing potential who is pregnant, breast-feeding or intend to become pregnant or is not using adequate contraceptive methods (adequate contraceptive measures include sterilisation, hormonal intrauterine devices, oral contraceptives, condom with spermizide, sexual abstinence or vasectomised partner)

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination
